entry.title: The Good
entry.summary: When I was a kid, we rooted for the good guys.
entry.content:
When I was a kid, we rooted for the good guys.

The heroes.

The ones who saved people. Beat up villains.

And it was clear. It was clear who the heroes were. And who the villains were.

And today, to me, it's not as clear.

You live long enough, stuff turns upside down.

Who are your heroes?

Who are your villains?

Who is the best person you know? Not talking fame, wealth, or power.

Who has the best heart? Who is bravest? Who do you love the most?

Is it still cool to be good?

entry.title: It's Not Business, It's Personal
entry.summary: So this is going to be a personal thing. And as…
entry.content:
So this is going to be a personal thing. And as a private person, the question then becomes: How personal do I want to get?

Where am I right now?

I'm good. I'm really good. Lucky. Blessed.

It wasn't always this way. Or maybe it was, but I didn't see it.

I see now.

They say youth is wasted on the young. But maybe it really is wisdom wasted on the old.

I sure am wiser than I used to be. But maybe I'm just getting old.

In the 80s, there was this curmudgeon of a wrestler named Terry Funk, a Texas cowboy heel who they would call "Middle-Aged and Crazy!" He used to brand our heroes with an iron from his ranch and swing his fists at ghosts. I used to love to hate him.

But he makes more sense to me, now.

I'm not saying I'm crazy (I'll leave the middle aged part alone), but the things I've done in my life probably only would make sense to few.

I'm being vague purposefully. I don't know how much I want to share. But it's always been personal, never business.

At least with me. Always personal.

entry.title: Two-A-Days
entry.summary: Yeah, yeah. I'm excited. Want to create as many entries as…
entry.content:
Yeah, yeah. I'm excited. Want to create as many entries as I can to see how they stack.

Nothing to see here. No one's looking anyway.

I hope. You looking? Blog looker.

These are the ramblings of a guy who has nothing really to say.

Other than: Thank You.

Can I still write?

entry.title: Kicking the Door Down
entry.summary: I recognize this is just blabbering. These are new digs for…
entry.content:
I recognize this is just blabbering. These are new digs for me. A new frame. Just wondering what happens when I flip this switch and plug a new thing in.

Will it hold up? Has so far. I like it.

entry.title: Repetitions
entry.summary: Got to get my reps in. Exercise my fingers. Click clack.
entry.content:
Got to get my reps in. Exercise my fingers. Click clack. Click clack.

Day two. Entry two.

Make writing every day a habit.

Mental note: remember those who join gyms in January, train every day for two weeks, and never return.

We are, like all things, in this for the long game.

entry.title: Second Chances
entry.summary: I wrote a lot a long time ago. Not so much…
entry.content: I wrote a lot a long time ago. Not so much anymore. Maybe that changes.
